required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CAT-8015 in Children, Adolescents and Young Adults With Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia or Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Multicenter, Dose Escalation Study of CAT-8015 in Children, Adolescents and Young Adults With Refractory CD22+ Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) or Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL)

brief_summary.textblock: To estimate maximum cummulative dose (MTCD) of CAT-8015 that can be safely administered to a patient.

detailed_description.textblock: To estimate the maximum tolerated cummulative dose (MTCD), defined as the highest dose and number of doses that can be safely administered to a patient, and to establish a safe dose, based on the MTCD, for subsequent clinical testing.

primary_outcome.measure: Estimate the maximum tolerated cummulative dose (MTCD), defined as the highest dose and number of doses that can be safely administered to a patient, and establish a safe dose, based on the MTCD, for subsequent clinical testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize the tolerability and safety profile.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after last dose of study drug/per subject

intervention.description: The dose level of the initial cohort will be 5 µg/kg. Cohorts will be at doses of 5, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60.... µg/kg until toxicity supervenes. Following the identification of the MTCD, the MTCD cohort will be expanded to 12 subjects. Dose escalation to a new cohort may not occur until authorization by the medical monitor, which will require all patients from the prior cohorts have reached cycle 1 day 21 without dose limiting toxicity (DLT) if eligible for retreatment
